answers.answer: My daughter had almost the exact same symptoms.  We would take her to the doctors and then, no diagnosis.   One day after she graduated she got into a car wreck and then, off to the Emergency Room.  She has a fairly rare condition called, Wolffe-Parkinson-White Syndrome.  The symptoms creep up in later teen years and are often very prevalent in early 20's.  It is a heart condition that has to do with the electrical aspect of it, not a cholesterol issue.  Your parents might be interested in seeing this. Hope this helps!

question: Hi,Over the years, I have had a sudden surge of nausea, sharp headache to the left of my temple, which is just the beginning, then it climaxes. I am fully conscious, I feel fatigue, fever, my vision goes fuzzy and there is a splash of colors then everything goes black. I have full mobility, walk, drink water, everything, and I discovered if I sit down and fixate my head towards the ground, then my vision regains and all of my symptoms go away. I have already been tested for diabetes and it's been clean. Is it heat exhaustion? I'm not sure, if you could post any ideas that would be great!Thanks. (also I am underweight for my age I don't know if this will help)
title: Strange Blackouts
